image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: Users have reported Facebook's AI search has shown incorrect information about four-year-old Gus who remains missing in SA's outback.

title.children: Expert cautions AI use as it gives misinformation about missing SA boy

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A Port Pirie woman has been bailed after police downgraded a murder charge laid over the death of a man to aggravated assault.

title.children: Woman's murder charge downgraded over Port Pirie death

image.altText: A red sign on a bus shelter reading Buy the Best, Buy SA Seafood

props.synopsis: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

title.children: Seafood 'good as it's ever been' as sellers fear algal bloom message not getting through

image.altText: An empty potato shelf at Woolworths in South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australia produces 80 per cent of Australia's fresh potatoes, but extreme weather and drought across the state are causing a major shortage.Â

title.children: Customers face empty shelves as farmers battle potato shortage

image.altText: Charlie Kirk is stood with a microphone in one hand and a red cap in the other.

props.synopsis: The Australian affiliate of late right-wing activist Charlie Kirk's Turning Point USA is moving into South Australia ahead of next year's state election, but some politicians say the group is "out of step with mainstream values".

title.children: Turning Point Australia moves into SA, ahead of state election

image.altText: Masooma smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

title.children: For Afghan refugee Masooma, fostering a child has given her a sense of freedom

image.altText: Man stands and looks at camera in a dairy shed.

props.synopsis: Some South Australian farmers say they are still feeling the strain of drought after inconsistent winter rains left little room for recovery before the coming summer.

title.children: South Australian farmers 'on knife edge' ahead of summer after a year of dry conditions

image.altText: Marine scientist Mike Steer.

props.synopsis: The face of South Australia's algal bloom response says the natural event "is not going to ruin summer" and he is looking forward to spending more time with his kids at the beach.

title.children: SA's algal bloom chief keen to hit the beach this summer

image.altText: A black and tan dachshund stands proudly in a lounge room

props.synopsis: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

title.children: The psychology of bringing 'mad' Valerie in from the wild

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: New legislation will be introduced to enshrine the powers of the Triple Zero Custodian into law.

title.children: Telcos face Canberra grilling as bill to improve triple-0 system is introduced

image.altText: A firefighter carries a hiker out on his back in the dark, with a group of people using head torches.

props.synopsis: Villagers have joined rescue crews in attempting to save those who have become stuck in heavy snow on Mount Everest in Tibet.

title.children: Hundreds of hikers still missing after Mount Everest blizzard

image.altText: A man in a suit holds a press conference with a concerned expression.

props.synopsis: Mr Lecornu stepped down just 14 hours after naming his Cabinet, plunging France into another political crisis.

title.children: Macron gives French PM days to save administration after snap resignation

image.altText: A sign with a photo of Epstein and Maxwell, urging peole to call if they have been a victim, is pointed to.

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court declines to hear Ghislaine Maxwell's bid to overturn her conviction for helping the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sexually abuse teenage girls.

title.children: US court declines Ghislaine Maxwell appeal against sex trafficking conviction

image.altText: A woman sits a court deck.

props.synopsis: Less than a year after the landmark trial which shook the world, GisÃ¨le Pelicot will once again brave a courtroom as one of her rapists appeals his sentence.

title.children: GisÃ¨le Pelicot to face rapist once again in French appeals case

image.altText: A composite image of Megan Fox, Joshua Elmes, Alicia Montebello and Lucus Garzoli

props.synopsis: A coroner determines that the sole survivor of a crash that killed four people at Bochara was behind the wheel during the incident.Â

title.children: Coroner's warning on crash that killed adult and three teens

image.altText: A woman in a pantsuit sits on a chair next to a table of books.

props.synopsis: The author was best known for The Rutshire Chronicles, including the novel Rivals, which was recently adapted into a Disney+ series.

title.children: Jilly Cooper, English author known for her 'bonkbusters' dies at age 88

image.altText: A PowerPoint showing the three scientists with their faces, biography and a headshot

props.synopsis: The Nobel Prize for Medicine has been given to three scientists for discovering how our immune systems protect us from microbes.

title.children: Trio of scientists win Nobel Prize in Medicine for work on immune system

image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: A man who says he was threatened after investigating sovereign citizens says the movement should be labelled a terrorist organisation, but an academic argues this could lead to more violence.

title.children: Would declaring sovereign citizens 'terrorists' reduce violence, or fuel it?

image.altText: Firefighters battling urban bushfire

props.synopsis: New research from Australian researchers shows, globally, major bushfire events are becoming more frequent, fatal and economically damaging.Â

title.children: Australia's south coast 'very, very high risk' for bushfires, modelling shows

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: Victoria's prison population has surged by 62 per cent in the last 20 years as the number of accused held on remand triples.

title.children: Rise in Victoria's prisoner numbers outpace population growth

image.altText: A portrait of Scott McDougall wearing a suit jacket, white shirt and light blue tie in front of a green background.

props.synopsis: Queensland's outgoing human rights commissioner says he has lost sleep worrying about some juveniles "spending weeks and weeks" in the state's watch houses.

title.children: Boy's 'haunting' expression in watch house drives home concerns for commissioner

image.altText: An image of Callan Park, a sandstone building with parkland, in the background + two old black and white pics of the building.

props.synopsis: The challenge of transforming a major piece of Sydney's public space from a former mental health hospital to an "iconic urban parkland" is a delicate dance for the state government.

title.children: Redevelopment dilemma for Sydney's former asylum sites

image.altText: Workers in high-vis use handheld drills to break through a large slab of concrete

props.synopsis: The number of people killed in the disaster could still rise, with some half a dozen children still unaccounted for.

title.children: At least 63 killed in Indonesian school collapse with others still missing

image.altText: Armed forces stand on a hazy city street

props.synopsis: The National Guard was deployed to Chicago streets in 1968. It changed the city forever.Â

title.children: The National Guard was deployed to Chicago in 1968 â it left the city 'traumatised'

image.altText: Erin Patterson with glasses on and head down gets into a van outside court

props.synopsis: Victoria's Director of Public Prosecutions will appeal the sentence handed down to convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson.

title.children: Prosecutors to appeal 'manifestly inadequate' sentence for Erin Patterson

image.altText: a woman with brown hair in a lab coat

props.synopsis: Tasmanian TAFE graduates worry as some locally taught courses that helped them forge a career may disappear as the cost to study them increases dramatically.

title.children: From $4,000 to $21,000 â lab training in Tasmania could be a thing of the past

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: Optus customers have come forward to report more cases of triple-0 calls failing outside the embattled telcos previously admitted outages.

title.children: Optus customers left angry after more failed triple-0 calls

image.altText: Lawrence Wong, a Singaporean man smiles while wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Singapore's Prime Minister, Lawrence Wong, offers his condolences to the families of four Australians who died during an Optus network technical failure last month, which impacted hundreds of triple-0 calls.

title.children: Singapore PM gives condolences to families impacted by Optus outage deaths

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape says there is a "high possibility" the country would not enter a conflict involving Australia and China, despite having signed a mutual defence treaty with its southern neighbour.

title.children: Marape says PNG would stay neutral in any potential Australia-China conflict

image.altText: weatherboard home off its stumps, with security fence around it

props.synopsis: The NSW Reconstruction Authority says the breach occurred in March and involved the personal data of applicants to the Northern Rivers Resilient Homes Program.

title.children: Major data breach as up to 3,000 flood victims' details loaded to ChatGPT

image.altText: Snow covered Mount Bogong

props.synopsis: Locals in Victoria's High Country are warning visitors about the unpredictable conditions in the alpine region, after the bodies of two women were discovered near Falls Creek.

title.children: Dead hikers yet to be identified as locals warn of High Country danger

image.altText: Man in suit points into the distance, stands in front of Australian flag

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is calling for the political temperature to be "turned down" after a Queensland man was charged for allegedly threatening to kill him.

title.children: Alleged death threat signals time to 'turn the temperature down', PM says

image.altText: Lewis Moody looks to one side

props.synopsis: Lewis Moody, a former England rugby captain who helped his side win the 2003 World Cup, has been diagnosed with Motor Neurone Disease.

title.children: Rugby World Cup winner reveals MND diagnosis

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

props.synopsis: A close family member of a tour guide who died in the Whakaari White Island eruption in 2019 has given an emotional statement as the inquest into the tragedy continues.

title.children: Frustrated families call for answers at Whakaari White Island inquest

image.altText: A hand reaches towards a chess piece on a board.

props.synopsis: World number two Hikaru Nakamura has beaten the current world champion Gukesh Dommaraju and thrown his king to the cheering crowd, prompting the chess world to debate whether it was showmanship or disrespect.

title.children: Chess world split over piece-throwing celebration
